result.execSummary:
The defendant Larrice J Powell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Status conference on June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Larrice J Powell in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. Offer has been made.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Larrice J Powell in court with attorney Katie Gutowski.  Defendant Larrice J Powell in custody.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.
